S2S Lecture 1 Introducing the textbook and pre-lecture reading Pre-Lecture 1 Reading

S2S Lecture 1 Introducing the textbook and pre-lecture reading The lectures will cover material from the textbook Probability and Statistics with R by Ugarte, Militino and Arnholt. See the Textbook information in the Textbook section on the S2S Moodle page Be sure to do the pre-lecture reading for each lecture to get the most out of the lectures. It's the pre-lecture reading material that's examinable, not just the lecture material Post questions in advance that you'd like answered in the lecture in "Your questions for lectures" on Moodle. Pre-Lecture 1 Reading The first lecture covers material from Chapter 2 Exploring Data and before the lecture you should read: 2.1 What Is Statistics? 2.2 Data 2.5 Summary Measures of Location 2.6.1-2.6.3 Summary Measures of Spread

R Code 2_18 library(MASS) # MASS package contains data frame Cars93 opar <- par(no.readonly = TRUE) # read in current parameters par(mar=c(0.1, 7.1, 0.1, 0.1)) # more space needed on side 2 with(data = Cars93, boxplot(Min.Price, ylim = c(0, 50), ylab = "Minimum Price (in \\$1000)\n for basic version", col = "springgreen3")) f <- with(data=Cars93, fivenum(Min.Price)) # store fivenum values in f text(x = rep(1.25, 5), y = f, labels=c("Min", expression(H[L]), expression(Q[2]) , expression(H[U]), "Max"), pos=4) par(opar) # reset to original parameters Show the plot R Code 2.18 from Probability and Statistics with R, Ugarte et al. (2016).

R Code 2_19 library(PASWR2) # PASWR2 contains data frame BODYFAT BODYFAT$sex <- factor(BODYFAT$sex, labels = c("Female", "Male")) boxplot(fat ~ sex, data = BODYFAT, col = c("gray80", "gray20"), ylab = "Percent Bodyfat") Show the plot R Code 2.19 from Probability and Statistics with R, Ugarte et al. (2016).
